textBeforeTable: (resistor images and color codes courtesy of WIlfried, DL5SWB's R-Color Code program) Stage Bill of Materials TX Opamps Bill of Materials go directly to build notes) (above schematic has clickable areas that can be used for navigation) ( Click for Full Schematic) (Resistor testpoints (hairpin, top, or left-hand lead), as physically installed on the board, are marked in the schematic with red dots) ( TX Opamps Schematic go directly to build notes) (see the Theory of Operation in the TX Mixer (QSE) Stage) ( Theory of Operation These four outputs will be muxed together in the Mixer Stage to produce the desired exciter output (thus, the term Quadrature Sampling Exciter (QSE)). This stage has a pretty large part count.. It consists of four unitary gain op-amps, arranged in pairs, one per stereo line out signal into the board. The left channel's input resolves to two signals: 0� and 180�. The right channel's input resolves to two signals: 90� and 270�. textAfterTable: TX Opamps Summary Build Notes Install Bottomside Components Install Topside Components Install IQ-In Jack and Jumpers Test the Stage TX Opamps Detailed Build Notes Top of the Board Install Topside Components After installing R21 and R22, you might ant to run a quick powered test at the junction (R21 hairoin lead). R21/22 form a voltage divider on the 5 volt rail and you should see one-half the 5 volt rail voltage WRT regular ground (about 2.5 Vdc).
